required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Exenatide on Sleep in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Exenatide on Sleep and Circadian Function in Type 2 Diabetes: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators propose a pilot study to test the novel hypothesis that Exenatide treatment in patients with type 2 diabetes results in improved sleep duration and quality and to explore the relationship between improvements in sleep and measures of metabolic and circadian function. This project would be the first to probe the relationship between incretin hormone regulation, duration and intensity of sleep, glucose tolerance and circadian dysfunction in diabetic patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Total minutes of non-REM sleep was measured

primary_outcome.measure: Total Amount of Slow Wave Activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Total amount of slow wave activity during sleep derived from laboratory polysomnogram was measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep efficiency will be calculated as total sleep time over total recording time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minutes of Wake After Sleep Onset During Sleep Recording
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: total amount of time spent awake after sleep onset and before morning awakening will be calculated

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) will be calculated from polysomnographic recordings. The minimum score for AHI is 0 (zero), corresponding to total absence of apnea or hypopnea. There is no theoretical maximum score although scores above 100 are very rarely observed. The lower the AHI value, the better. Higher AHI values correspond to greater severity of sleep apnea, a worse outcome. There are no subscales. We use continuous AHI values to measure severity of obstructive sleep apnea.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean plasma levels of glucose will be calculated from samples collected across the 24-h cycle.

arm_group.description: Subjects will continue on Type 2 DM therapy but will add placebo injected subcutaneously twice daily to their regimen for a total of 6 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide
arm_group.description: Subjects will continue on Type 2 DM therapy but will add injectable exenatide to their regimen There will be twice daily treatment with subcutaneous injections of 5 µg of Exenatide for 2 weeks followed by 4 weeks of treatment with twice daily subcutaneous injections of 10 µg of Exenatide.

intervention.description: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide

intervention.description: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of T2DM based on physician documentation according to established guidelines will be eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with unstable cardiac, neurological or psychiatric disease
- Women who are pregnant or report trying to get pregnant will be excluded.
- Patients treated for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) will be excluded.
- Patients with established OSA will be included only if they have declined treatment of OSA.
- Patients with morbid obesity (BMI ≥ 40 gk/m2)
- Patients on insulin
- Patients already taking an incretin-based drug will not be included
- Patients with renal disease (creatinine clearance <30 ml/min), gastroparesis and history of pancreatitis will also be excluded based on known possible adverse medication side effects.
- Patients taking an insulin secretagogue will be excluded.
- Patients with Hemoglobin A1c values greater than or equal to 10 will be excluded.

group.title: Usual T2 DM Med Regimen
group.description: Subjects will continue on Type 2 DM therapy but will add placebo injected subcutaneously twice daily to their regimen for a total of 6 weeks. Placebo: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks

group.title: Usual T2 DM Med Regimen Plus Exenatide
group.description: Subjects will continue on Type 2 DM therapy but will add injectable exenatide to their regimen There will be twice daily treatment with subcutaneous injections of 5 µg of Exenatide for 2 weeks followed by 4 weeks of treatment with twice daily subcutaneous injections of 10 µg of Exenatide. Exenatide: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks

Exenatide: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks

outcome.title: Non-REM Slow Wave Sleep
outcome.description: Total minutes of non-REM sleep was measured
outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: The Electronic Sleep Recordings for one participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen were corrupted and could not be analyzed. One participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide had a very short sleep periods during the study and his data could not be interpreted, therefore this patient was excluded from the analysis.

Exenatide: Exenatide or placebo medication administered subcutaneously 5 mcg twice daily for 2 weeks, followed by 10 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks

measure.title: Non-REM Slow Wave Sleep
measure.description: Total minutes of non-REM sleep was measured
measure.population: The Electronic Sleep Recordings for one participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen were corrupted and could not be analyzed. One participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide had a very short sleep periods during the study and his data could not be interpreted, therefore this patient was excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Total Amount of Slow Wave Activity
outcome.description: Total amount of slow wave activity during sleep derived from laboratory polysomnogram was measured
outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: The second primary outcome measure, slow-wave activity (SWA) was not collected.

outcome.title: Sleep Efficiency During Polysomnographic Recording
outcome.description: Sleep efficiency will be calculated as total sleep time over total recording time.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: The Electronic Sleep Recordings for one participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen were corrupted and could not be analyzed. One participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide had a very short sleep periods during the study and his data could not be interpreted, therefore this patient was excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Severity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea
outcome.description: The apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) will be calculated from polysomnographic recordings. The minimum score for AHI is 0 (zero), corresponding to total absence of apnea or hypopnea. There is no theoretical maximum score although scores above 100 are very rarely observed. The lower the AHI value, the better. Higher AHI values correspond to greater severity of sleep apnea, a worse outcome. There are no subscales. We use continuous AHI values to measure severity of obstructive sleep apnea.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and after 6 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: The Electronic Sleep Recordings for one participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen were corrupted and could not be analyzed. One participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide had a very short sleep periods during the study and his data could not be interpreted, therefore this patient was excluded from the analysis.

There is no theoretical maximum score although scores above 100 are very rarely observed. The lower the AHI value, the better. Higher AHI values correspond to greater severity of sleep apnea, a worse outcome. There are no subscales. We use continuous AHI values to measure severity of obstructive sleep apnea.

One participant in Usual T2 DM med regimen plus Exenatide had a very short sleep periods during the study and his data could not be interpreted, therefore this patient was excluded from the analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: When the investigators were unblinded in August 2016, a randomization error originating from the industry sponsor was identified, where only 8 participants were randomized to exenatide while 10 were randomized to placebo.
